reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Braighe House was perfect. It was a beautiful setting. We stayed there for one night. We were touring the west coast and the islands or we would have stayed longer! The hospitality by both Alison & John was lovely. Our King Room was big and beautifully decorated and the en-suite was great. The shower was big and powerful and there were lots of little extras. The breakfast menu was wonderful and the food even more so.
reviews.title: Best Guest House we have ever stayed in!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you Alison & John. We will hopefully be back!
reviews.title: A superb place to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great welcome from John. He and his wife Alison are a great couple who cannot do enough for you. Public rooms are stylishly decorated (including a restful lounge), bedrooms are individually styled with have top quality fittings and bedlinen, bathrooms are luxurious. The breakfast menu has an amazing choice. Slightly pricey, but well worth it.
reviews.title: Best I have been to in Hebrides

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: Superb location, £6 taxi ride from Stornoway Town centre, but what a view across the Minch. John our host greeted us with a beaming smile and could not do enough for us during our stay. After our night in Stornoway we relaxed to a free glass of P in the lounge watching TV. John offered me a beer and my wife a glass of wine. Premises are unlicensed and this was offered a friendly gesture and not for any other reason. Rooms were of a very high quality (Choose the superior with its sea view its worth the extra) that extra touch and attention to detail, i.e. with bathrobes and luxurious toiletries making worthy of its 5 star rating. Breakfast was one of the best, great choice, home made muesli and yoghurts adding that personal touch and the quality and choice were second to none. Thanks once again to John & Alison for making our stay such an enjoyable one..
reviews.title: Words cannot describe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here in october 2006, just myself with my young daughter. She was 3 at the time. And it was tottally incredible! I usually go three star but i chose this property as i thought it looked nice. We were welcomed in a very friendly way. The family are lovely! And its a short walk from the bnb to a beach which was great for my daughter! I dont drive so we used the island bus service which was regular and stopped right outside the bnb. It's a very reasonable service, and the drivers are more than ok about helping you on the bus with a buggy. One morning the family's daughter offered to give us a lift into the town centre before she went to school which was extremely hospitable. Really nice. On the morning we left it was blowing a gale outside, and in order to catch the ferry we left at about 6am, but the owner helped us get into the taxi and even made us a packed lunch for the journey home, which included jelly peices for the wee yin and crisps and juice etc. This amazed me! i have never had such an amazing service! And was an extra touch that really made the holiday memorable. I have been to Stornoway three times in total but my pictures and memories from the three days i spent in october 2006 are the best! My little girl loved it! And the quality of such an amazing bnb made it that way! Would definately recommend this accomodation to anyone! The rooms were lovely, well serviced, the owner even helped to dry clothes out, and was aware of anything else which we may have needed help with.
reviews.title: Absolutely Superb B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Braighe House for two nights in September - the first of several stops on our tour of the Outer Hebrides and it certainly set the benchmark for hospitality, comfort and service.
reviews.title: Fabulous stay in Stornoway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived late off the Harris ferry and made our way up to Stornoway. Braighe House was easy to find on the causeway just by Stornoway airport. The room was big, modern and well appointed - free wifi, hospitality tray, TV/DVD player and a lovely big ensuite shower room with The White Company toiletries. The bed was big and comfy and we slept brilliantly.
reviews.title: Only average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010
reviews.text: Breakfast offered a wonderful choice of hot and cold options - I tried both and would heartily recommend both.
reviews.title: A real home-away-from-home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: John, one of the owners, took time to offer suggesitons of places to visit and what might be open on a Sunday; not much as it turns out, but that was absolutely no barrier to a very enjoyable day in the outdoors. As well as offering breakfast, on a Sunday Braighe House offers a packed lunch - this is a great idea as we didn't find many open shops and the packed lunch was very nice. Thinking ahead, John had reserved a table for dinner for us on Sunday night which was a lovely and thoughtful touch.
reviews.title: Absoutely beautiful, peaceful night by the sea... followed by delicious breakfast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The modern and spacious lounge, with Sky TV, was available to guests and a glass of (very tasty) vintage port was also available of an evening.
reviews.title: wonderful bed and breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Braigh House for 2 nights and were delighted with our room, the accomodation was pleasantly decorated and was spotlessly clean. The host and hostess were attentive to our needs and very flexible. We found them to be very friendly and extremely helpful. Our only complaint was the poor tv reception!
reviews.title: Excellent Accomodation & Service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The views across the Minch to the snowcapped peaks in Wester Ross were stunning. Very welcoming and warm - both the house and the owners Alison and John. Spotlessly clean with very comfortable beds. The breakfast choices were delicous especially the homemade yoghurt and really freshly squeezed orange juice, and of course the Braighe Stack (with Stornoway Black Pudding) was perfect.
reviews.title: This place is faultless

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: The vintage port you were welcome to take a glass of was a very nice touch and very nice at the end of the day. We left at 6am for the early ferry and the heating had been put on early for us and our packed breakfast was ready for taking with us to eat when we were a bit more awake
reviews.title: The best sunrises on the island!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: . Compared to other places we have stayed on Lewis this is in a class of its own.
reviews.title: Home from Home, Excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The modern b&b is beautifully located and i had two of the greatest sunrises ever!
reviews.title: Excellent - lives up to the 5 stars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Braighe House is simply the best B&B we have ever visited. We have just returned from a multi island holiday in the inner and outer Hebrides staying at around seven different hotels. Braighe House is large property a couple of miles beyond Stornoway Airport and overlooking the sea with distant views to Skye. The elegant house if furnished to the highest standards with great attention to making visitors both comfortable and welcomed. Our room was spacious with a good bathroom and everything needed to make our short stay impressive. Alison and John readily made reservations for restaurants and organised taxis for us. Alison's breakfasts should be viewed by other hotels and B&B owners as they are impressive and original - home made yogurt, granola and bananas was delicious. If youneed to visit Stornoway, this is the place to stay.
reviews.title: Best accommodation on our multi island holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is really a small hotel rather than a B&B. Our room was large, clean and well decorated, and we had a glorious sea-view. We were initially concerned seeing so many cars on the drive, that the place was huge, but learned the owners also operate a rental company, to which these vehicles belonged. Lovely sitting room, with complimentary drinks. When I mentioned a flower I had seen, the hostess researched it and left me a note on my bed with its name - fabulous service! My only criticism is the inflexibility of breakfast times. We, in common I suspect with many other guests given the location, needed to leave early for the ferry, but the breakfast on Sunday did not begin till nine. Instead we were given a sandwich, granola bar, apple and juice box. I would have preferred that the price be reduced in such circumstances when the second B of B&B was not provided, and we could have purchased a meal ourselves on the ferry.
reviews.title: Needs to be more flexible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Spent three nights in late May - a wonderful experience in every respect. Spacious and welcoming public areas and warm sizeable bedrooms. The bathrooms were large and well provided with all the usual amenities.
reviews.title: Exceptional experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having taken part in the Stornoway half marathon on a wet and windy Saturday my gear was rinsed and dried in double quick time. The prize of a black pudding was cooked the following morning for breakfast!
reviews.title: Extremely clean, extremely helpful and accomodating hosts!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our hostess could not do enough to make our stay more enjoyable, breakfasts were hearty and the choice amazing given the fact that all provisions had to be shipped from the mainland. The kippers were undoubtedly the best on the island!
reviews.title: Home from home
